Articles.Content:
Hey guys,

I've been thinking of a good challenge to do lately, and watching all of those EJ streams making Kerbin bases gave me the idea for a Kerbin Polar Base challenge! The challenge is pretty simple, build and sustain a base at one of the poles. However, the pieces can not be launched on a sub-orbital trajectory to get there fast. They have to be brought in by planes or ships. Also, crew rotation. No keeping kerbals at sub-zero temperatures for decades at a time. Here's the scoreboard:

Base itself:

+10 points for each module of base

+20 for having a fuel depot

+25 for having an ISRU module

-30 for using giant rockets to boost you modules there quickly

Transfer craft:

+15 for using ships instead of planes

+10 for using skids on landing instead of wheels

+20 for VTOL

+5 for horizontal landing

Extras:

+30 for building a working launchpad at your base, and launch at least one satellite with a rocket launched there rocket

+10 for each additional launch

-10 for each mod used (kerbal engineer allowed, no mechjeb)

Edited November 12, 2015 by MajorLeaugeRocketScience
As a fellow ej viewer, I accept this challenge!

Update: Patch!! Wear this if you do the challenge!!

Sorry for the low quality, btw we definitely didn't just spraypaint Santa over Space, right?
